main event: A UFO was observed in the South Pacific on June 15, 1963, appearing initially as a first magnitude star before fading.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes., The object was initially at 330 degrees azimuth and 78 degrees elevation., The object faded at 355 degrees azimuth but was lost in cloud cover., Observations were made using ground radar., The case evaluation suggested the object could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature.
sighted object: UFO resembling a first magnitude star
location: South Pacific, Unknown Region, Unknown Country
